answers.answer: Well, the older we get, the harder it is to lose weight, but if you eat right and exercise, the weight should come off.What are your latest results for TSH, FT3 and FT4?  If you could post them, along with the reference ranges, since these are lab specific and must come from your own lab report.Once members see your results, we can comment more fully on your situation.  It's possible that even though your results fall into the "normal" category, they are normal for YOU.Obesity and lack of exercise are 2 of the most common causes of type II diabetes. Other causes are, of course, genetics; along with high blood pressure, high fat diet, high alcohol intake, etc.  Is it possible you have some of these risk factors that would make your Dr think that?

question: My DR has my thyroid in normal limits yet I still am abnormally tired and overweight.  I used to maintain a weight of 120 with no problem; any gain could be easily dealt with and came off easily.  Now, the fat won't budge and I find I fall asleep if I sit down very long.  I am on levothroxin 1.15.  Can you suggest something else that might help or is what I'm going thru "normal" with this condition.  I am also around 60 years old... could that be part of the problem.My DR also maintains I will get diabetes 2 at some point.  Is this connected with Hashi?Thank you.
title: HASHI
